Attributes.Section: 8.4.2: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Platform (GCP) multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled for all Google Identity users that use a console password. The rule is COMPLIANT if MFA is enabled.
Requirements.Name: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

Attributes.Section: 8.4.2: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your GCP account is enabled to use multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Google Cloud Platform accounts. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any accounts can sign in without a valid MFA setup.
Requirements.Name: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

Attributes.Section: 8.4.2: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the root user of your GCP account requires multi-factor authentication for console sign-in. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) root account user does not have multi-factor authentication (MFA) enabled.
Requirements.Name: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

Attributes.Section: 8.4.2: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Object Versioning is enabled in Google Cloud Storage (GCS) buckets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Object Versioning is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: 8.4.2: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud IAM users have multi-factor authentication (MFA) enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if MFA is not enabled for at least one IAM user.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud IAM

Attributes.Section: 8.4.3: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Platform (GCP) multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled for all Google Cloud Identity users. The rule is COMPLIANT if MFA is enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Identity

Attributes.Section: 8.4.3: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud Platform (GCP) account is enabled to use multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any virtual MFA devices are allowed for signing in with the administrator account.
Requirements.Name: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

Attributes.Section: 8.4.3: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the root user of your GCP account requires multi-factor authentication for console sign-in. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Google Cloud Identity root account user does not have multi-factor authentication (MFA) enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Identity

Attributes.Section: 8.4.3: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Object Versioning is enabled on Google Cloud Storage (GCS) buckets and requires additional security measures for delete operations. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Object Versioning is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: 8.4.3: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

Requirements.Description: Checks if active IAM service account keys are rotated (changed) within the number of days specified in maxAccessKeyAge. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if service account keys are not rotated within the specified time period. The default value is 90 days.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud IAM

Attributes.Section: 8.6.3: Use of application and system accounts and associated authentication factors is strictly managed.

Requirements.Description: Verifies if the organizations Google Cloud Identity password policy adheres to specified requirements for users. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the password policy does not comply with these requirements.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Identity

Attributes.Section: 8.6.3: Use of application and system accounts and associated authentication factors is strictly managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Secret Manager secret has rotation enabled. The rule also checks an optional maxRotationFrequency parameter. If the parameter is specified, the rotation frequency of the secret is compared with the maximum allowed frequency. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the secret is not scheduled for rotation. The rule is also NON_COMPLIANT if the rotation frequency is higher than the specified maxRotationFrequency parameter.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Secret Manager

Attributes.Section: 8.6.3: Use of application and system accounts and associated authentication factors is strictly managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Secret Manager secrets are rotated successfully according to the rotation schedule. Secret Manager calculates the date the rotation should happen. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the date passes and the secret isn't rotated.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Secret Manager

Attributes.Section: 8.6.3: Use of application and system accounts and associated authentication factors is strictly managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Secret Manager secrets have been rotated in the past specified number of days. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a secret has not been rotated for more than maxDaysSinceRotation number of days. The default value is 90 days.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Secret Manager

Attributes.Section: 8.6.3: Use of application and system accounts and associated authentication factors is strictly managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a backup vault has an attached IAM policy that prevents deletion of backup recovery points. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Backup Vault does not have IAM policies or has policies lacking a suitable 'Deny' statement for deleting backups.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Backup and DR

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Database Migration Service (GCP DMS) instances are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'public' option is set to true.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Database Migration Service

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Firestore snapshots are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any Google Cloud Firestore snapshots are public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firestore

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Persistent Disk snapshots are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or more snapshots have permissions that allow public access.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) Pods only have read-only access to their root filesystems. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the readOnlyRootFilesystem field in the Pod security context is set to 'false'.
Requirements.Name: Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE)

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Filestore instances are configured to enforce a root directory. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the root directory is set to '/' (default root directory of the file system).
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Filestore

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Filestore (GCP equivalent of Amazon EFS) access points are configured to enforce a user identity. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'IAM permissions' are not defined or if parameters are provided and there is no match in the corresponding parameter.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Filestore

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud account has VPC firewall rules set to block public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'allowIngressFromAll' is true, or if true, ports other than Port 22 are open to ingress traffic from any source.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud VPC

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Google Cloud Functions IAM policy attached to the Cloud Function resource prohibits public access. If the Cloud Function IAM policy allows public access it is NON_COMPLIANT.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Functions

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud SQL database instance snapshot is shared publicly. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any existing and new Cloud SQL snapshot is shared publicly.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Google Cloud SQL instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the `ipConfiguration.requireSsl` field is false and there are any public IP addresses assigned to the instance.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud SQL backups are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any existing and new Google Cloud SQL backups are public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google BigQuery datasets do not have public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the dataset's 'access' configuration includes entries that grant 'allUsers' or 'allAuthenticatedUsers' permissions.
Requirements.Name: Google BigQuery

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage (GCS) bucket access settings have uniform bucket-level access enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if uniform bucket-level access is not enabled for GCS buckets.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Verifies if the necessary public access prevention settings are applied at the project level. The rule is considered NON_COMPLIANT only when the specified settings do not align with the corresponding settings in the configuration item.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access prevention settings are configured at the project level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the configuration item does not match one or more settings from parameters (or default).
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage buckets are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Cloud Storage bucket is not listed in the excludedPublicBuckets parameter and the bucket access control settings allow public access.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Object Versioning is enabled and if Object Versioning is configured to require the 'Object Versioning' actions to be performed with the appropriate IAM policies in Google Cloud Storage (GCS). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if these configurations are not met.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud Storage buckets do not allow public read access. The rule evaluates the Uniform Bucket-Level Access settings, the bucket IAM policies, and ACLs to ensure they are properly configured to prevent public access.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud Storage (GCS) buckets do not allow public write access. The rule checks the Bucket IAM policies, Uniform bucket-level access settings, and the bucket access control list (ACL).
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if direct internet access is disabled for a Google AI Platform Notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an AI Platform Notebook instance is internet-enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google AI Platform Notebooks

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Deployment Manager configurations owned by the account are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Deployment Manager configurations with the owner 'Self' are public.
Requirements.Name: Deployment Manager

Attributes.Section: A1.1.2: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Endpoints APIs are of the type specified in the rule parameter endpointConfigurationType. The rule returns NON_COMPLIANT if the REST API does not match the endpoint type configured in the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Endpoints

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Cloud Endpoints API service uses an SSL certificate. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API service does not have an associated SSL certificate.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Endpoints

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud App Engine services are associated with Google Cloud Armor security policies. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for a Google Cloud App Engine service if it is not associated with a security policy.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud CDN distributions are associated with Google Cloud Armor security policies. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Cloud CDN distribution is not associated with a Cloud Armor security policy.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud CDN

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the SSL certificate associated with a Google Cloud CDN is the default SSL certificate. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Cloud CDN uses the default SSL certificate.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud CDN

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Cloud Source Repositories URL contains sign-in credentials or not. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the URL contains any sign-in information and COMPLIANT if it doesn't.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Source Repositories

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Database Migration Service (GCP DMS) migration jobs are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the PubliclyAccessible field is set to true.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Database Migration Service

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Firestore backups are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any Google Cloud Firestore backups are public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firestore

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Google Cloud VPN's authorization policies allow connection access for all users. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'AllowAll' is present and set to true.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud VPN

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the status of the Google Cloud Resource Manager Policy compliance is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after the policy execution on the resource. The rule is compliant if the field status is COMPLIANT. For more information about organizations and policies, see Understanding Organization Policies.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Resource Manager

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Cloud VPN requires 'auto-accept' for shared attachments to be enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for a Cloud VPN if 'auto-accept' is set to 'true'.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud VPN

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Verifies if the Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) cluster endpoint is not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the endpoint is publicly accessible.
Requirements.Name: Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE)

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Search (a service similar to Amazon OpenSearch) instances are in Google Virtual Private Cloud (Google VPC). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Google Cloud Search instance is publicly accessible.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Search

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud HTTP(S) Load Balancers have backend services that are configured to use SSL certificates from Google Cloud Managed Certificates or Google Cloud IAM Certificates. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if at least 1 load balancer has at least 1 backend service configured without a certificate or is configured with a certificate different from Google Cloud Managed Certificates or IAM certificates.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Load Balancing

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Google Cloud Load Balancers use SSL certificates provided by Google Managed SSL Certificates. To use this rule, use an SSL or HTTPS frontend configuration with your Google Cloud Load Balancer. This rule is only applicable to Google Cloud Load Balancers. This rule does not check other types of load balancers.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Load Balancing

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud account has public access settings enabled for its Compute Engine instances. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'blockPublicIp' is false, or if true, any firewall rules allow ingress traffic on ports other than Port 22.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Compute Engine

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: In GCP, the equivalent for disabling incoming SSH traffic can be achieved by configuring firewall rules to disallow ingress on port 22, effectively restricting SSH access.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firewall

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Cloud Router is associated with an authorized Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) in Google Cloud Platform (GCP). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Cloud Router is associated with an unauthorized VPC.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud VPC

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Google Cloud Functions IAM policy attached to the Cloud Function resource prohibits public access. If the Cloud Function IAM policy allows public access it is NON_COMPLIANT.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Functions

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Cloud Function is allowed access to a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Cloud Function is not VPC enabled.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Functions

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud firewall rules allow unrestricted ingress traffic for SSH (port 22) and RDP (port 3389). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a firewall rule allows ingress traffic from any source IP range (0.0.0.0/0) for those ports.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firewall

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud Platform (GCP) firewall policy is configured with a user-defined 'default action' for fragmented packets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the default action for fragmented packets does not match the user-defined default action.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firewall

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Check GCP Firewall Rule is associated with ingress or egress rules. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no ingress or egress rules are associated with the Firewall Rule, else COMPLIANT if any one of the rule types exists.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firewall

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Firewall Rule contains rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules in a GCP Firewall Rule.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firewall

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are public routes in the route table to a Cloud Router or Cloud NAT. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a route to a Cloud Router or Cloud NAT has a destination CIDR block of '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' or if a destination CIDR block does not match the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Networking

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Elasticsearch (GCE) clusters are within a Google Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Elasticsearch cluster endpoint is public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Elasticsearch (GCE)

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are any Google Cloud SQL database instances that are not using the default Cloud SQL service account. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are any Cloud SQL instances that are not using the default service account.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud SQL instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'ipAddresses' field contains a public IP address.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google BigQuery datasets are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the dataset's access control configuration allows public access.
Requirements.Name: BigQuery

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage (GCS) buckets have uniform bucket-level access enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if uniform bucket-level access is not enabled for GCS buckets.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access options are configured at the project level in Google Cloud Platform (GCP). The rule is only NON_COMPLIANT when the public access settings do not match the configured settings.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access prevention settings are configured at the project level in Google Cloud Platform. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the configuration does not match one or more settings from parameters (or default).
Requirements.Name: Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage buckets are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Cloud Storage bucket does not meet the exclusion criteria and has bucket-level permissions that allow public access.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud Storage buckets do not allow public read access. The rule verifies the Uniform Bucket-Level Access settings, the bucket IAM policies, and the bucket permissions.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud Storage buckets do not allow public write access by evaluating the Bucket IAM policies and public access prevention settings.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google AI Platform Notebooks instance is launched within a VPC or within a list of approved subnets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a notebook instance is not launched within a VPC or if its subnet ID is not included in the parameter list.
Requirements.Name: Google AI Platform Notebooks

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if direct internet access is disabled for a Google Cloud AI Platform Notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an AI Platform Notebook instance is internet-enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud AI Platform

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Private Service Access for the service specified in the rule parameter is configured for each Google Cloud VPC. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Google Cloud VPC doesn't have a Private Service Access configured for the service.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud VPC

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are unused firewall rules in Google Cloud. The rule is COMPLIANT if each firewall rule is associated with a network. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a firewall rule is not associated with a network.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud VPC Firewall Rules

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Firewall rules allowing unrestricted incoming traffic ('0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0') only allow inbound TCP or UDP connections on authorized ports. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if such firewall rules do not have ports specified in the rule parameters.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firewall

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud Armor security policy contains any rules. The policy is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules present within the security policy.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud Armor security policy contains any rules. The policy is NON_COMPLIANT if no rules are present within the Google Cloud Armor security policy.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Verifies if a Google Cloud Armor Security Policy contains any firewall rules or rule groups. The policy is considered NON_COMPLIANT if it does not include any security rules or rule groups.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Cloud Armor security policy rule groups contain any rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules present within a Cloud Armor security policy rule group.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether the Google Cloud Armor security policy contains rules with conditions. The rule is COMPLIANT if the security policy contains at least one rule with conditions and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a GCP Cloud Armor Security Policy contains any rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no security rules present within a Cloud Armor Security Policy.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.1.3: Multi-tenant service providers protect and separate all customer environments and data.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Endpoints services have access logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'accessLogSettings' is not present in the service configuration.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Endpoints

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if all methods in Google Cloud Endpoints have logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled, or if the log level is neither ERROR nor INFO.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Endpoints

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Trace tracing is enabled on Google Cloud Endpoints. The rule is COMPLIANT if Cloud Trace tracing is enabled and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Endpoints

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud API Gateway has logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or the 'logLevel' is neither ERROR nor ALL.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud API Gateway

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Load Balancers are configured with a user-defined Desync mitigation mode. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Load Balancer's Desync mitigation mode does not match the user-defined Desync mitigation mode.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Load Balancing

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud CDN is configured to deliver access logs to a Google Cloud Storage bucket. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Cloud CDN configuration does not have logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud CDN

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if at least one Google Cloud Audit logging configuration is logging read and write events for all Google Cloud Storage buckets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no audit logs configured to record Cloud Storage data events.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks that there is at least one Google Cloud Audit Logging enabled for a project with security best practices. This rule is COMPLIANT if there is at least one audit log configuration that meets all of the following criteria.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Logging

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Logging Log Buckets are encrypted with any Google Cloud KMS key or a specified Google Cloud KMS key Id. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Log Bucket is not encrypted with a KMS key or is encrypted with a KMS key not supplied in the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Logging

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: In GCP, the equivalent for enabling CloudTrail is enabling Cloud Audit Logs, which tracks API activity for projects and services.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Audit Logs

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Logging is configured to use Cloud Key Management Service (Cloud KMS) encryption. The rule is COMPLIANT if the KmsKeyId is defined.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Logging

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Audit Logs have integrity validation enabled. Google Cloud recommends that integrity validation should be enabled for all audit logs to ensure their authenticity. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the validation is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Audit Logging

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud Build configuration has at least one logging option enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the status of all present logging configurations is set to 'DISABLED'.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Build

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled with a valid severity level for GCP Data Migration Service replication task events of a target database. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or replication task logging of a target database has a severity level that is not valid.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Data Migration Service

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud Firestore (NoSQL document database) instance has Cloud Logging export enabled for audit logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Google Cloud Firestore instance does not have Cloud Logging export enabled for audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firestore

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud VPN has logging enabled for client connections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'logging.enabled' is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud VPN

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is configured on active Google Cloud Run services. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an active service does not have logging enabled or the logging configuration is not set for at least one revision.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Run

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) cluster is configured with logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging for GKE clusters is not enabled for all log types.
Requirements.Name: Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE)

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud App Engine services are configured to send logs to Google Cloud Logging. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the value of 'enableStackdriverLogging' is false.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud App Engine

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Google Cloud Load Balancer has logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'logging' property is false or the 'logBucket' is not equal to the provided bucket name.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Load Balancer

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Pub/Sub subscriptions have Cloud Logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a subscription does not have logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Pub/Sub

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud Pub/Sub subscription has logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the subscription does not have logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Pub/Sub

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: In GCP, the equivalent of enabling multi-region logging is to ensure that Cloud Logging is set up to collect logs from multiple regions. This ensures that logs are stored and accessible across different geographical locations.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Logging

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud Spanner instance has Stackdriver Logging enabled for audit logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Spanner instance does not have Stackdriver Logging enabled for audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Spanner

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Platform (GCP) firewall rules have logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not configured. You can specify which logging type you want the rule to check.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firewall

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud SQL instances for MySQL are configured to log audit logs to Google Cloud Logging. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Cloud SQL for MySQL instances do not have audit log publishing configured.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the respective logs of Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL or MySQL are enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any log types (like general logs, slow query logs, or audit logs) are not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google BigQuery datasets have audit logging enabled to a specific Cloud Storage bucket. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if audit logging is not enabled for a BigQuery dataset or if the 'bucketNames' parameter is provided but the audit logging destination does not match.
Requirements.Name: Google BigQuery

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google BigQuery datasets have the specified settings. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the BigQuery dataset is not encrypted or encrypted with another key, or if the dataset does not have audit logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: BigQuery

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if DNS query logging is enabled for your Google Cloud DNS managed zones. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DNS query logging is not enabled for your Google Cloud DNS managed zones.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud DNS

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage (GCS) buckets are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a GCS bucket is not listed in the excludedPublicBuckets parameter and bucket level settings are public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled for your Cloud Storage buckets in GCP. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Workflow has logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Cloud Workflow does not have logging enabled or the logging configuration is not at the minimum level provided.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Workflows

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Virtual Private Cloud (GCP VPC) flow logs are found and enabled for all GCP VPCs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if flow logs are not enabled for at least one GCP VPC.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud VPC

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled on Google Cloud Armor security policies. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the logging is enabled but the logging destination does not match the specified value.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled on Google Cloud Armor security policies. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for a security policy, if it does not have logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A1.2.1: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.

Requirements.Description: Checks if you have provided security contact information for your Google Cloud Platform project. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if security contact information within the project is not provided.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud IAM (Identity and Access Management)

Attributes.Section: A1.2.3: Multi-tenant service providers facilitate logging and incident response for all customers.
Attributes.Service: Google Cloud IAM (Identity and Access Management)

Requirements.Description: Checks if automated sensitive data discovery is enabled for Google Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if automated sensitive data discovery is disabled. The rule is APPLICABLE for administrator accounts and NOT_APPLICABLE for member accounts.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud DLP

Attributes.Section: A3.2.5.1: PCI DSS scope is documented and validated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is enabled in your project. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'status' attribute is not set to 'ENABLED'.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP)

Attributes.Section: A3.2.5.1: PCI DSS scope is documented and validated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if automated sensitive data discovery is enabled for Google Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if automated sensitive data discovery is disabled. The rule is APPLICABLE for administrator accounts and NOT_APPLICABLE for member accounts.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP)

Attributes.Section: A3.2.5.2: PCI DSS scope is documented and validated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is enabled in your project. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the DLP API is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud DLP

Attributes.Section: A3.2.5.2: PCI DSS scope is documented and validated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Trace tracing is enabled on Google Cloud Endpoints. The rule is COMPLIANT if Cloud Trace tracing is enabled and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Trace

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud Deployment Manager configurations send event notifications to a Google Cloud Pub/Sub topic. Optionally checks if specified Pub/Sub topics are used. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Deployment Manager configurations do not send notifications.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Deployment Manager

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Monitoring alert policies have notification channels configured for the 'ALERTING', 'PENDING', or 'DISABLED' states. Optionally checks if any channels match a specified notification channel ID. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there is no notification channel specified for the alert policy or optional parameter.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Monitoring

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a resource type has a Cloud Monitoring alert policy for the specified metric. For resource types, you can specify Persistent Disks, Compute Engine instances, Cloud SQL instances, or Cloud Storage buckets. The rule is COMPLIANT if the specified metric has a resource ID and a Cloud Monitoring alert policy.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Monitoring

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether Google Cloud Monitoring alerts with the given metric name have the specified settings.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Monitoring

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Audit Logs are configured to send logs to Google Cloud Logging. The audit logging is NON_COMPLIANT if the log sink is not properly set up or is not sending the audit logs to Google Cloud Logging.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Logging

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Stackdriver Monitoring is enabled for Google Compute Engine instances. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Stackdriver Monitoring is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Compute Engine

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage (GCS) Notifications are enabled on a GCS bucket. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if GCS Notifications are not set on a bucket, or if the event type or destination do not match specified event types and destination parameters.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Security Command Center is enabled for a Google Cloud project. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Google Cloud Security Command Center is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Security Command Center

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Pub/Sub logging is enabled for delivery status of messages sent to a topic. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Pub/Sub

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Monitoring metrics collection on Google Cloud Armor security policies is enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'enableMonitoring' field is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A3.3.1: PCI DSS is incorporated into business-as-usual (BAU) activities.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Cloud Storage bucket has an attached IAM policy which prevents deletion of objects. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Cloud Storage bucket does not have IAM policies or has policies without a suitable 'Deny' statement (statement with storage.objects.delete permission).
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Database Migration Service (Cloud DMS) connection profiles are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'public' property is set to true.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Database Migration Service

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Firestore database snapshots are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any Firestore database snapshots are public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firestore

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Persistent Disk snapshots are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or more snapshots have permissions that allow public access, indicating that Google Cloud Persistent Disk snapshots are public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Compute Engine

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) Containers only have read-only access to their root filesystems. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the securityContext.privileged parameter in the container specification is set to 'false' or the readOnlyRootFilesystem parameter is not set to 'true'.
Requirements.Name: Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE)

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Filestore instances are configured to enforce a root directory. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the root path is accessible without restrictions.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Filestore

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Filestore access control is configured to enforce a user identity. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'identity' is not defined or if parameters are provided and there is no match in the corresponding parameter.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Filestore

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud account has block public access settings enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'BlockPublicAccess' is false, or if true, firewall rules allowing traffic on ports other than Port 22 are listed in 'AllowedFirewallRules'.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Firewalls

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if IAM groups in Google Cloud have at least one IAM user assigned.
Requirements.Name: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud IAM users have passwords or active access keys that have not been used within the specified number of days you provided. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are inactive accounts not recently used.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud IAM

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Google Cloud Functions IAM policy attached to the Cloud Function prohibits public access. If the Cloud Function IAM policy allows public access it is NON_COMPLIANT.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Functions

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud SQL instance snapshot is public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any existing and new Cloud SQL instance snapshots are public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud SQL instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'publicIp' field is enabled in the instance configuration.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud SQL backups are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any existing and new Google Cloud SQL backups are public.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud SQL

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google BigQuery datasets are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the dataset's defaultAccessEntry has a role of 'READER' granted to 'allUsers'.
Requirements.Name: BigQuery

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage bucket IAM policies have public access prevention settings enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public access prevention settings are not enabled for Google Cloud Storage buckets.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Verifies that the required public access prevention settings are configured at the project level. The status is considered NON_COMPLIANT when the specified settings do not match the corresponding fields in the project configuration.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access prevention settings are configured at the project level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the configuration item does not match one or more settings from parameters (or default).
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage (GCS)

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage buckets are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Cloud Storage bucket is not listed in the excludedPublicBuckets parameter and the bucket's permissions settings allow public access.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Object Versioning is enabled and if it requires additional authentication for critical actions in Google Cloud Storage buckets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if additional authentication is not required.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud Storage buckets do not allow public read access. The rule checks the Uniform Bucket-Level Access settings, the bucket policy, and the bucket access control list (ACL).
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud Storage buckets do not allow public write access. The rule checks the Uniform bucket-level access settings, the bucket IAM policies, and the bucket access control list (ACL).
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if direct internet access is disabled for a Google Cloud AI Platform Notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an AI Platform Notebook instance is internet-enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud AI Platform Notebooks

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Secret Manager secrets have been accessed within a specified number of days. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a secret has not been accessed in 'unusedForDays' number of days. The default value is 90 days.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Secret Manager

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Compute Engine instance templates owned by the account are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if instance templates with the owner 'Self' are set to allow public access.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Compute Engine

Attributes.Section: A3.4.1: Logical access to the cardholder data environment is controlled and managed.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Trace is enabled on Google Cloud Endpoints. The rule is COMPLIANT if Cloud Trace is enabled and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Endpoints

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Google Cloud deployments (using Deployment Manager) send event notifications to a Google Cloud Pub/Sub topic. Optionally checks if specified Pub/Sub topics are used. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Deployment Manager deployments do not send notifications.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Deployment Manager

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Cloud Monitoring alerts have notification channels configured for ALERTING, PENDING, or NO_DATA states. Optionally checks if any notification channels match a specific resource name (ARN). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there is no action specified for the alert or optional parameter.
Requirements.Name: Cloud Monitoring

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Google Cloud resource type has a Google Cloud Monitoring alert policy for the specified metric. For resource types, you can specify Compute Engine instances, Cloud Storage buckets, Cloud SQL instances, or Persistent Disks. The rule is COMPLIANT if the specified metric has a resource ID and an alert policy.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Monitoring

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether Google Cloud Monitoring alerts with the given metric name have the specified settings.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Monitoring

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Audit Logging is configured to send logs to Cloud Logging. The audit log configuration is NON_COMPLIANT if the log sink is not properly set to export logs.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Logging

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Stackdriver Monitoring is enabled for Google Compute Engine instances. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Stackdriver Monitoring is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Monitoring

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Storage (GCS) notifications are enabled on a GCS bucket. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if GCS notifications are not set on a bucket, or if the event type or destination do not match the specified event types and destination parameters.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Storage

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Security Command Center is enabled for a Google Cloud Project. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Security Command Center is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Security Command Center

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Pub/Sub logging is enabled for the delivery status of messages sent to a topic. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Pub/Sub

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Google Cloud Monitoring (formerly Stackdriver) security metrics collection on Google Cloud Armor rule sets is enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'enableMonitoring' field is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Google Cloud Armor

Attributes.Section: A3.5.1: Suspicious events are identified and responded to.
